metadata.title: CVE-2013-4590 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Apache Tomcat before 6.0.39, 7.x before 7.0.50, and 8.x before 8.0.0-RC10allows attackers to obtain "Tomcat internals" information by leveraging thepresence of an untrusted web application with a context.xml, web.xml,*.jspx, *.tagx, or *.tld XML document containing an external entitydeclaration in conjunction with an entity reference, related to an XMLExternal Entity (XXE) issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4590` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet2.4-java - 6.0.39-1
libservlet2.5-java - 6.0.39-1
libtomcat6-java - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6 - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6-admin - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6-common - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6-examples - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6-extras - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6-user - 6.0.39-1
No subscription required

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.52-1
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.52-1
tomcat7 - 7.0.52-1
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.52-1
tomcat7-common - 7.0.52-1
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.52-1
tomcat7-user - 7.0.52-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat6 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.39-1').
tomcat7 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.0.52-1').
